beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Lone Wolf Gravel? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Lone Wolf Gravel scored 47 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Lone Wolf Gravel?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Lone Wolf Gravel. Iron Mountain, Michigan. 62 mi. Rolling to hilly Upper Peninsula wilderness gravel.
beats.text_on_screen: Lone Wolf Gravel | Iron Mountain, Michigan | 62 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Value. 4 out of 5. Good value. More bang for your buck than most. Race proceeds directly support local fire department equipment purchases, giving entry fees community impact beyond event costs. Expenses. 4 out of 5. Budget carefully. The extras get you. Length. 3 out of 5. Proper race distance. Enough to hurt. The 62-mile distance hits the sweet spot for most gravel riders, with 36, 50, and 100-mile options available. Elevation. 3 out of 5. Proper climbing. You'll earn your descents. The 4,000 feet over 62 miles includes what creators call "chunky steep climbs" in Michigan's Upper Peninsula terrain. Adventure. 3 out of 5. This race takes you somewhere different. Community. 3 out of 5. Genuine community feel. People stick around. Iron Hills Cycling Team promotes "community and support among local residents of Dickinson County" through cycling. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Functional. Not impressive. Start location coordinates provided (gravel pit off Sportsmens Club Road), but conflicting start times listed - BikeSignup says 9:15 AM while MGRS says 7:00 AM. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Your road bike might survive. Might. James Morrow describes "pristine, hard pack, fast gravel, accompanied by chunky steep, climbs, and rowdy descents.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Climate. 2 out of 5. Weather cooperates more often than not. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Adequate. Room for improvement. Experience. 2 out of 5. Pleasant enough. Won't change your life. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Zero name recognition. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Small field. You might podium by showing up.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Upper Peninsula Wilderness Ride. Only if you're in the Upper Peninsula or planning UP tourism. Not worth the long drive for the race alone.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.
